Posts.Title: Fat Graft Transfer and the Radiated Breast whippetmom dancetrancer

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2016 05:36PM ual0307 wrote: hi! Sorry rads are on your treatment plan.  I had 33 rad treatments, including five boosts. My skin got very dark. Peeled. Oozed. Hurt. Lots of fun. I used the pads and they really helped cool the burn. I'd recommend not buying anything until you see how you will react. I had a really bad time, but others seemed to not have much pain. So wait. Best of luck to you.
Posts.Title: lindi skin cooler pads buttaflydiva ual0307

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2015 08:13PM ual0307 wrote: I worked through chemo and rads as well. Rads were very painful towards the end. Peeling, oozing, dark dark skin. I ended up with lung damage on radiated side (we are watching); and my PS said skin damage is as bad as he has seen (oh Boy!). I hated my rad onc, like I hated nothing else during this adventure.
